TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

I decided sleep can wait

Now relax and sleep! Time is infinite.

Polaris Exterior is done now, with structural element for RCS.

Too much Delta-V, it has as much as the real concept (3,000m/s) and I landed it on the Mun easily.

IVA

W.I.P. I plan to re-do most IVAs, so this one will "set the standard". The basic shell is done, but I will invest in a few more "props" to give the interior some character.

The inside is, understandably, very cramped.

Great forward view!

Yeah Toned it down to around 1,000m/s, which seems okay. Being able to do a flyby of Jool with an Orbiter seemed over power.

Excitement continues!

Good to hear!

The Polaris release will unfortunately mean the start of a long-ish hiatus in work.

But it will come along with some other goodies (Texture improvements on Tantares, Redone Vega doors, better balancing), so hopefully it can keep people happy.

After this, don't expect anything until 0.24 has been out a while.

I know people have expressed excitement to TKS, but sadly it is not for some time.

I plan maybe a bit of rejuvenation of Soyuz and LK (as they are really focus of this pack.). This would mean new models:

A few higher polycount.

Nothing decided yet, just an idea I throw around.

Enjoy!

Edited June 29, 2014 by Beale

It's your mod, so you can obviously do whatever you want, but I'd really appreciate it if you did some work on the interiors of the current command pods before making more parts. Make the lit up buttons functional like they are in the stock command pods as well as the majority of modded ones. Another thing that would make your mod a million times better is integrating RasterPropMonitor screens into your IVA's. I like doing missions in IVA which is a lot easier and more fun with RPM.

I'm not sure how difficult what I'm asking is, I just wanted to give you some feedback from someone who really enjoys your parts, but doesn't really use them because of these minor things they are lacking.

It's your mod, so you can obviously do whatever you want, but I'd really appreciate it if you did some work on the interiors of the current command pods before making more parts. Make the lit up buttons functional like they are in the stock command pods as well as the majority of modded ones. Another thing that would make your mod a million times better is integrating RasterPropMonitor screens into your IVA's. I like doing missions in IVA which is a lot easier and more fun with RPM.

I'm not sure how difficult what I'm asking is, I just wanted to give you some feedback from someone who really enjoys your parts, but doesn't really use them because of these minor things they are lacking.

No no, I definitely agree with you!

Continuing on, it has become greatly apparent that the current IVAs are not up to scratch, even with the Stock ones (nevermind amazing mod ones, Spaceplane Plus has my jaw on the floor).

I've been playing around with RPM and... I'm converted, I love it. So expect that also.

(It will always be optional, I promise!)

So do not fear, think of current IVAs more like placeholder "convenient EVA buttons" (though hopefully Polaris is heading in the right direction?).

One thing, I did not know stock prop buttons had functions, can you give an example?

EDIT:

MFD Tantares docking with Vega

Hey Beale,

I saw on the first page that you posted a few edits that other people made of your work. I thought I'd do my own! Using rescaleFactor = 2, I scaled up the Tantares, Polaris, and Spica. This is in addition to changing the weight of the parts, and increasing the torque. It's a small change but if anyone wants it, it's available at: https://www.dropbox.com/s/2jfiz2pwxq9u96x/Tantares%20Rescale.rar

It's just the folder architecture and the .cfg files, so it can be dragged and dropped over a regular Tantares install. Kerbals and HGR for scale:

Fuji rescale is really interesting!

Beale, I love the Fuji. The only part that bugs me a little is how flat the heat shield is. I tried using a tweaked SDHI heat shield to get a look similar to this:

http://www.shokabo.co.jp/author/8758/fujicapsuleC1.jpg

I think that's too much the other way (after all it's flatness is whats cool and defining about it...), but something in the middle might be nice? Just a thought.

http://imgur.com/zl4iIzQ
hrmmmmm ... just have thrown this together .. and i must say: such a beauty! the Parts are awesome and fit the stock parts very well.

Dgtasby, why'd you opt to only rescale the RCS struts by 1.5? Just curious.

At full 2.0 scale the model covered up the bottom node, so you couldn't attach anything underneath. I'm a total scrub at modding, so I don't know how to move those nodes!

At full 2.0 scale the model covered up the bottom node, so you couldn't attach anything underneath. I'm a total scrub at modding, so I don't know how to move those nodes!

Weird - I had a little trouble with the nodes "migrating", but not enough to pose a real problem.

But, relatively easy fix, no modeling required - the nodes are in the cfg.

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.2575, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 2
node_stack_top    = 0.0,  0.2575, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1

The second number describes the vertical distance, so find that in the part and raise it a bit, then test it in game. Probably a much easier way to do it but this is low-skill ha ha.
Thanks! I'll try it out!
WOO! so excited about the fuji!

Aside with the talking on another mod, I really like your work Beale and would welcome another stock-a-like apollo nonetheless
